name: 凌凱
objective: This class is aimed at giving the students a basic understanding of the German language. They will not only learn the most important vocabulary and grammar but also have plenty opportunity to make use of it. As a result, they hopefully will be able to master simple everyday situations in Germany, Austria and the German-speaking part of Switzerland.
schedule:
February 25: Activities to get to know each other: partner interview, introducing him or her to the teacher, asking the teacher questions
March 4: Reviewing what the students have learned last semester, especially lesson 7 in the textbook
March 11: Lesson 7-3: A working day / Mrs Winter has to go to hospital (grammar: § 11, 16a, 38, 46)
March 18: Lesson 7-4: A boy got lost at the autobahn service area! (dealing with the story from different perspectives)
March 25: Lesson 7-5: Marianne on a business trip to Vienna (reading a letter, telling a story by means of pictures, listening to the real story)
April 1: Lesson 8-1: In the city / Different institutions, where do people go when they need something... (grammar: § 16a)
April 8: Lesson 8-1: Mr Kern has to clear some things up / How do I get to the main station? (grammar: § 17)
April 15: Lesson 8-2: A city tour in Berlin (grammar: § 15, 16b, 44)
April 22: Midterm exam week
April 29: Lesson 8-2/3: How to get to Berlin? / Berlin - 30 years later (reading a newspaper article)
May 6: Lesson 9-1: Presents / What would you like to have? (grammar: § 3, 11, 38, 42, 43)
May 13: Lesson 9-1: What presents can you give to these people? (listening to dialogues, reading and writing a letter; grammar: § 11)
May 20: Lesson 9-2: The customer is king (comparing things, grammar: § 12, 21)
May 27: Lesson 9-3: The brand new Video Phone! (reading and dealing with advertisements)
June 3: Lesson 9-4: Now I am much happier! (analyzing an interview) / What's important in life? (grammar: § 21)
June 10: Lesson 10-1: German language and culture (What do you know about Germany, Austria and Switzerland? Quiz: famous people)
June 17: Lesson 10-2: The German speaking countries / Reading a map (grammar: § 4, 7, 10) / Reviewing
June 24: Final exam week
scorePolicy:
Class participation: 10%
Assignments: 20%
Quizzes: 10%
Midterm exam: 30%
Final exam: 30%
materials: As a textbook we use "Themen aktuell 1". It is a classic title for teaching German because of its systematic training of the four different skills: reading, listening, speaking, and writing. Along with the textbook comes a workbook (used for doing exercises at home) and three audio CDs.
